data.name: Will the Brick Sink?
data.description:
Someone has put a brick (its density is D1 kg/m³; height is a m; the brick is a perfect cuboid) into a liquid (of density D2 kg/m³), so that the height is perpendicular to the surface of the liquid. The height of its submerged part is h m (0 < h < a). Your task is to estimate if it'll emerge, remain floating at the same position, or sink. Please write a function ```javascript function willSink (D1, D2, a, h){...} ``` that will return:
  1. The brick will emerge by N % (in relation to the starting position; N is calculated and rounded to the nearest integer), or
  2. The brick will submerge by N % (in relation to the starting position; N is calculated and rounded to the nearest integer), or
  3. The brick will remain floating at the same position, or
  4. The brick will sink
Good luck!

Tips

  1. Due to the Archimedes' principle, a force, which is equal to the weight of liquid dislodged, acts upon a body put into the liquid. When this force is equal to the body's weight, it floats neither emerging nor submerging.
  2. Consider any two values equal while comparing them if they are equal being rounded to the 7th digit.
Contribution would be highly appreciated. English is not my first language, so if you find mistakes, freely correct them.
